the test of time. To say that a choice was wise implies that the action or inaction was strategically correct when judged by some set of values. Another formulation is "Making the best use of available knowledge."
−
strategicly correct, considering some specified value set.
+
  +
It is crucial realize that a wise decision must often be made from incomplete information. This requires the chooser to know that way that situations (of any sort) usually turn out. Thus a wise decision must be corrent and justified, but the justification need not be based on a true belief.
  +   +
Classically, wisdom is considered to come with age. A wise person is called a "sage."
